question: My dad is 69, with high blood pressure, diabetes, and now kidney problems.  He under went emergency heart surgery 3 days ago and is still on life support.   They say he can't sustain himself yet.  He has the heart pump and breathing tube still.   They say he is really sick and there is no progress forward.  None backwards, but none forwards either.  Is this normal under the conditions or should I prepare for possibly the worst.  Please help.
title: 5 way by pass surgery
